Pro Log: Vittoria Bussi reclaims UCI Hour record, Josh Tarling beats Remco Evenepoel at Chrono des Nations, Madis Mihkels and Gerben Thijssen pulled from Tour of Guangxi for racist gesture

Welcome back to another edition of Pro Log. Milan Vader (Jumbo-Visma) won Stage 4 and currently leads the ongoing Tour of Guangxi with one day remaining. It’s been an entertaining affair so far, with victories for Elia Viviani (Ineos Grenadiers), Jonathan Milan (Bahrain Victorious), Olav Kooij (Jumbo-Visma) and most recently Sebastián Molano (UAE Team Emirates) on Stage 5.

Meanwhile at the Tour of Türkiye, Alexey Lutsenko (Astana) topped the general classification as Chiara Consonni (UAE Team ADQ) won the overall at the Tour of Chongming Island.

In praise of the Hour Record

Vittoria Bussi surpasses 50km, reclaims Hour record

The cycling Hour record – the greatest distance covered in one hour on a bicycle – has been reclaimed by Vittoria Bussi at the Velodrome Bicentenario in Mexico. As part of her ‘Road2Record’ campaign which described the project as a ‘challenge and redemption’, the Italian became the first woman to surpass 50km in her ride, hitting a distance of 50.267km.

Bussi, who has a PhD in mathematics and whose GoFundMe raised €12,000 for the attempt, previously held the Hour record in 2018 with a distance of 48.007km. This was beaten by Joss Lowden (48.405km) three years later, who was in turn bested by Ellen van Dijk (49.254km) last May.

After setting the new mark, Bussi said, ‘I owe this to all those who supported me throughout the year, believing in me and my project. This achievement is the result of outstanding teamwork, and I want to thank everyone who contributed to making it happen.’

Josh Tarling goes wrong way, beats Remco Evenepoel

Not even sure where to start, unbelievable day.@joshytarling wins Chrono des Nations in front of the world champion and Fin takes 2nd in the junior version. Bonkers.

Josh went the wrong way at a roundabout near the end True Joshy style!

Super proud of both of them! pic.twitter.com/bbgSS0jfAo

— Michael Tarling (@tarling_michael) October 15, 2023

Not even a wrong turn could prevent Josh Tarling from claiming victory at the Chrono des Nations time-trial. The Ineos Grenadiers rider, who recently became European Champion in the elite men’s ITT, was fastest over the 45.4km route in France, beating Remco Evenepoel (Soudal-QuickStep) by 13 seconds. Tarling’s victory comes just 12 months after he won the Junior Chrono des Nations.

In the women’s race, Austian national time-trial champion Anna Kiesenhofer beat fellow countrywoman Christina Schweinberger (Fenix-Deceuninck) by a single second over 27.2km.

Madis Mihkels, Gerben Thijssen pulled from Tour of Guangxi

Updated statement on Madis Mihkels and Gerben Thijssen. https://t.co/MhNnkfIBbl pic.twitter.com/End82rGbtD

— Intermarché-Circus-Wanty (@IntermarcheCW) October 11, 2023

Just before the six-day Gree-Tour of Guangxi, Madis Mihkels and Gerben Thijssen of Intermarché-Circus-Wanty were pulled from the race. Mihkels had pulled back his eyes to make a ‘slanted eye’ gesture while laughing, and Thijssen then posted it to his Instagram story. Intermarché-Circus-Wanty initially released a statement to condemn Mihkels and withdraw him from the race. An hour later, they added Thijssen’s name in an updated release.

The statement reads: ‘We sincerely regret the behaviour of our riders Madis Mihkels and Gerben Thijssen and the images shown on social media. We would like to apologise to the Chinese people and fans, to the government of Guangxi, to the Chinese Cycling Association, and all parties involved in the organisation of the Tour of Guangxi for the image given of our sport.

‘Our team Intermarché-Circus-Wanty… and our partners always defend equal opportunities and fight daily against racism. We withdraw Mihkels and Thijssen from the race and [will] take the necessary disciplinary steps to close this incident.’

See you next week.
